title: Limit partners list to exactly 5 entries

requirements.summary: Ensure the static partners data array in Partners component contains exactly 5 partner entries, removing any entries beyond the 5th to prevent rendering more than 5 cards.
acceptanceCriteria: The Partners section displays exactly 5 partner cards — no more, no less.
No sixth or additional partner card is visible on the page.
All 5 displayed partner cards show correct names, designations, and details.

file_operations.description: Review the static partners data array and remove any partner entries beyond the 5th entry. Ensure the array contains exactly 5 partner objects so that only 5 partner cards are rendered on the page. Do not modify partner details (names, designations, specializations) — only cap the array length to 5.

requirements.summary: Cap the rendered partner list to the first 5 entries when backend data (from useGetPartners) returns more than 5 partners, ensuring the UI never displays more than 5 partners regardless of backend data.
acceptanceCriteria: When backend returns more than 5 partners, only the first 5 are rendered.
The partners section never shows more than 5 cards under any data condition.

file_operations.description: Add logic to slice the partners array to a maximum of 5 entries before rendering. If useGetPartners returns backend data, apply `.slice(0, 5)` to cap the list. If using static data, ensure it never exceeds 5 entries. This ensures the UI always displays exactly 5 partners regardless of data source.
